ggDoE 0.6.3
  • Reference

ggDoE

Installation

You can get the development version from GitHub:

#install.packages("remotes") 
remotes::install_github("toledo60/ggDoE")

Overview

With ggDoE you’ll be able to generate common plots used in Design of Experiments with ggplot2.

The following plots are currently available:

  • alias_matrix(): Correlation matrix plot to visualize the Alias matrix

  • boxcox_transform(): Boxcox transformation plot

  • diagnostic_plots(): Regression diagnostics plots

  • gg_boxplots(): Boxplots used for comparing distributions between each group

  • half_normal(): Half-Normal effects plot

  • interaction_effects(): Interaction effects plot between two factors in a factorial design

  • main_effects(): Main effect plots for one factor in a factorial design

  • pareto_plot(): Pareto plot of effects with cutoff values for the margin of error (ME) and simultaneous margin of error (SME)

library(ggDoE)

Alias Matrix

alias_matrix(design=aliased_design)

alias_matrix(design=aliased_design, symmetric=TRUE)

Box-Cox Transformation

model <- lm(s2 ~ (A+B+C+D),data = adapted_epitaxial)
boxcox_transform(model,lambda = seq(-5,5,0.2))

Boxplots

gg_boxplots(data = throughput_dat,response = Throughput,factor = Machine,
            alpha = 0.7,color_palette = 'viridis')

Regression Diagnostic Plots

data(mtcars)
mtcars_lm <- lm(mpg ~.,data=mtcars)
diagnostic_plots(mtcars_lm)

Half-Normal Plot

m1 <- lm(lns2 ~ (A+B+C+D)^4,data=original_epitaxial)
half_normal(m1)

half_normal(m1,method='Zahn',alpha=0.1,
            ref_line=TRUE,label_active=TRUE,
            margin_errors=TRUE)

Interaction Effects Plot (Factorial Design)

interaction_effects(adapted_epitaxial,response = 'ybar',
                    exclude_vars = c('s2','lns2'))

interaction_effects(adapted_epitaxial,response = 'ybar',
                    exclude_vars = c('A','s2','lns2'),
                    ncols=3)

Main Effects Plots (Factorial Design)

main_effects(original_epitaxial,
             response='s2',
             exclude_vars = c('ybar','lns2'))

main_effects(original_epitaxial,
             response='s2',
             exclude_vars = c('A','ybar','lns2'),
             color_palette = 'viridis',
             ncols=3)

Pareto Plot

m1 <- lm(lns2 ~ (A+B+C+D)^4,data=original_epitaxial)
pareto_plot(m1)

pareto_plot(m1,method='Zahn',alpha=0.1)
